abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo will introduce legislation aimed at easing student loan burden of thousands of college graduates; proposal stipulates that state cover two years of loan payments for graduates of New York State colleges who earn less than $50,000 a year.
lead_paragraph: Under the proposal, the state would cover two years of loan payments for graduates of New York State colleges who make less than $50,000 a year, continue to live in the state and are enrolled in a federal repayment program.
snippet: Under the proposal, the state would cover two years of loan payments for graduates of New York State colleges who make less than $50,000 a year, continue to live in the state and are enrolled in a federal repayment program.

headline.main: Cuomo to Offer Plan to Cut College Graduates’ Debt
headline.print_headline: Cuomo to Offer Plan to Cut College Graduates’ Debt
